description: From dialectal English gaum (“heed, attention”) +‎ -less (“without”), from Old Norse gaum, from Proto-Germanic *gaumaz, *gaumō (“heed, attention”). The ‘r’ found in this spelling is a vowel-lengthening device common in non-rhotic dialects of English.

adjectives.description: gormless (comparative more gormless, superlative most gormless)

entries.meaning: (chiefly UK, New Zealand, Australia, Ireland, of a person) Lacking intelligence, sense or understanding; foolish.
